datastructures

Class Node<K>

  • java.lang.Object
    • datastructures.Node<K>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - the type of the data stored in the node

    public class Node<K>
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for representing nodes of a tree
    Author:
    Romain Mormont

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Node()
      Constructs a node with no data in it
      Node(K data)
      Constructs a node containing the given data

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int countDescendant()
      Returns the number of descendant of the node

      Returns the data stored in the node

      Returns the nth child of the node
      boolean hasChildren()
      Returns true if the node has children nodes
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns true if the node does not contain any data
      boolean isLeaf()
      Returns true if the node is a leaf (it has no child)

      Returns the number of children of the node

        Returns true if the node does not contain any data
        Returns:
        false if the node stores some data, false otherwise
